title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {gbifexplorer: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries},   author = {{Antonio J. Pérez-Luque}},   year = {2023},   url = {https://ajpelu.github.io/gbifexplorer/}, }

what: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries
title: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries
text: goal gbifexplorer provide tools explore different types gfbif dataset classes: Occurrence, Sampling-event Checklist. gbifexplorer allows explore taxonomic, temporal /spatial coverages gbif datasets.

title: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries
text: can install development version gbifexplorer GitHub :

title: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries
text: gbifexplorer package provides several functions exploring analyzing occurrence data Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF). example usage three key functions: cov_temporal, taxonomic_cov, report_taxonomy. use dataset contains information phenology flora Mediterranean high-mountains meadows Sierra Nevada region (Spain). dataset deposited GBIF also published Data Paper. also included example data gbifexplorer pkg.

what: Calculate the Temporal Coverage of an Ocurrence Dataset
title: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries
text: gbifexplorer::cov_temporal() function calculates temporal coverage dataset based specified date variable provided user. determines minimum maximum dates date variable returns data frame. returns data frame (temporal_coverage) contains minimum maximum dates dataset. function also prints temporal coverage text used document metadata dataset.
code: library(gbifexplorer) data("borreguiles")  # Calculate temporal coverage temporal_coverage <- cov_temporal(borreguiles, date_var = "eventDate",                                    date_format = "%Y-%m-%d") #> The temporal coverage of the dataset is 1988-05-18 to 2013-10-17.

what: Get the Taxonomic Coverage of an Ocurrence Dataset and report it.
title: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries
text: gbifexplorer::taxonomic_cov() function generates taxonomic coverage dataframe. calculates record numbers relative frequencies taxonomic category specified, allowing compute taxonomic coverage occurence dataset. function returns named list tibbles summarizing taxonomic coverage category. result list contains tibbles summarizing taxonomic coverage taxonomic category. , possible generate Report different taxa categories using gbifexplorer::report_taxonomy() function. generates summary report taxonomy specified taxa rank, provides information represented taxa based frequency information taxa rank. default top 5 represented taxa change using argument top instance, interested 5 frequent order: user might also interested calculate taxonomic coverage taxonomic categories present occurrence dataset. , also used purrr package
code: # Calculate taxonomic coverage for scientificName and genus d <- taxonomic_cov(borreguiles, category = c("class", "order")) d #> $class #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   class             n   freq #>   <chr>         <int>  <dbl> #> 1 Magnoliopsida  6057 55.1   #> 2 Liliopsida     4882 44.4   #> 3 Psilotopsida     63  0.573 #>  #> $order #> # A tibble: 19 × 3 #>    order              n     freq #>    <chr>          <int>    <dbl> #>  1 Poales          4869 44.3     #>  2 Lamiales        1378 12.5     #>  3 Fabales         1190 10.8     #>  4 Asterales       1032  9.38    #>  5 Gentianales      996  9.05    #>  6 Ranunculales     460  4.18    #>  7 Caryophyllales   425  3.86    #>  8 Celastrales      209  1.90    #>  9 Malpighiales     200  1.82    #> 10 Ericales         103  0.936   #> 11 Ophioglossales    63  0.573   #> 12 Apiales           31  0.282   #> 13 Saxifragales      17  0.155   #> 14 Boraginales        9  0.0818  #> 15 Liliales           8  0.0727  #> 16 Asparagales        5  0.0454  #> 17 Brassicales        3  0.0273  #> 18 Rosales            3  0.0273  #> 19 Myrtales           1  0.00909 report_taxonomy(d$order, top = 5) #>   There are 19 order included in the dataset. The 5 order most represented in the dataset are: Poales (44.26 %), Lamiales (12.52 %), Fabales (10.82 %), Asterales (9.38 %) and Gentianales (9.05 %). library(purrr) all_taxa <- taxonomic_cov(borreguiles, category = "all")  all_taxa |>    purrr::map(~report_taxonomy(., top=10)) |>    purrr::list_transpose() #> [[1]] #>   There are 94 scientificName included in the dataset. The 10 scientificName most represented in the dataset are: Nardus stricta L. (9.35 %), Carex nigra (L.) Reichard (6.67 %), Euphrasia willkommii Freyn (6.47 %), Lotus corniculatus L. subsp. glacialis (Boiss.) Valdés (5.49 %), Scorzoneroides (5.32 %), Eleocharis quinqueflora (Hartmann) O.Schwarz (4.54 %), Festuca iberica (Hack.) Patzke (4.46 %), Carex nevadensis Boiss. & Reut. (4.38 %), Gentiana boryi Boiss. (3.7 %) and Plantago nivalis Jord. (2.92 %). #>  #>   All records belong to the kingdom Plantae #>   There are 2 phylum included in the dataset. The 2 phylum most represented in the dataset are: Magnoliophyta (99.43 %) and Pteridophyta (0.57 %). #>  #>   There are 3 class included in the dataset. The 3 class most represented in the dataset are: Magnoliopsida (55.05 %), Liliopsida (44.37 %) and Psilotopsida (0.57 %). #>  #>   There are 19 order included in the dataset. The 10 order most represented in the dataset are: Poales (44.26 %), Lamiales (12.52 %), Fabales (10.82 %), Asterales (9.38 %), Gentianales (9.05 %), Ranunculales (4.18 %), Caryophyllales (3.86 %), Celastrales (1.9 %), Malpighiales (1.82 %) and Ericales (0.94 %). #>  #>   There are 28 family included in the dataset. The 10 family most represented in the dataset are: Cyperaceae (21.12 %), Poaceae (19.52 %), Fabaceae (10.82 %), Asteraceae (9.01 %), Gentianaceae (8.82 %), Scrophulariaceae (7.22 %), Ranunculaceae (4.18 %), Caryophyllaceae (3.75 %), Juncaceae (3.61 %) and Plantaginaceae (2.92 %). #>  #>   There are 52 genus included in the dataset. The 10 genus most represented in the dataset are: Carex (16.58 %), Nardus (9.35 %), Scorzoneroides (9 %), Gentiana (8.8 %), Euphrasia (6.47 %), Lotus (5.49 %), Trifolium (5.33 %), Festuca (4.77 %), Eleocharis (4.54 %) and Agrostis (4.44 %).

what: Dataset: Phenology of flora of mediterranean high-mountains meadows (Sierra Nevada) — borreguiles
title: Dataset: Phenology of flora of mediterranean high-mountains meadows (Sierra Nevada) — borreguiles
text: dataset contains information phenology flora Mediterranean high-mountains meadows Sierra Nevada region.

title: Dataset: Phenology of flora of mediterranean high-mountains meadows (Sierra Nevada) — borreguiles
Dataset: Phenology of flora of mediterranean high-mountains meadows (Sierra Nevada) — borreguiles
text: data frame 11002 observations 37 variables: id: ID observation. modified: modification date observation. language: language observation. institutionCode, collectionCode: institution collection code. datasetName: name dataset. basisOfRecord: basis record. occurrenceID: occurrence ID. catalogNumber: catalog number. recordedBy, recordedByID: name ID person recorded observation. eventDate: date observation. year, month, day: year, month day observation. continent: continent observation made. country: country observation made. countryCode: country code. stateProvince: state province observation made. county: county observation made. locality: locality observation. minimumElevationInMeters, maximumElevationInMeters: minimum maximum elevation meters. decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude: decimal latitude longitude observation. geodeticDatum: geodetic datum. coordinateUncertaintyInMeters: coordinate uncertainty meters. scientificName: scientific name plant species. kingdom, phylum, class, order, family: kingdom, phylum, class, order, family genus taxa. specificEpithet: specific epithet plant species. infraspecificEpithet: infraspecific epithet plant species. scientificNameAuthorship: scientific name authorship.

title: Dataset: Phenology of flora of mediterranean high-mountains meadows (Sierra Nevada) — borreguiles
text: Zamora R, Pérez-Luque AJ (2020). Dataset Phenology flora mediterranean high-mountains meadows (Sierra Nevada). Version 1.5. Sierra Nevada Global Change Observatory. Andalusian Environmental Center, University Granada, Regional Government Andalusia. Occurrence dataset doi: 10.15468/qhqzub Pérez-Luque AJ, Sánchez-Rojas CP, Zamora R, Pérez-Pérez R, Bonet FJ (2015). Dataset Phenology Mediterranean high-mountain meadows flora (Sierra Nevada, Spain). PhytoKeys 46: 89-107. doi: 10.3897/phytokeys.46.9116

title: Calculate the temporal Coverage — cov_temporal
text: function calculates temporal coverage dataset (occurrences, events, similar) based specified date variable.

title: Calculate the temporal Coverage — cov_temporal
code: cov_temporal(   x,   date_var,   date_format = NULL,   tryFormats = c("%Y-%m-%d", "%Y/%m/%d"),   report = TRUE )

title: Calculate the temporal Coverage — cov_temporal
text: x data frame. date_var name date variable column data frame. date_format format date variable (optional). tryFormats vector possible date formats try date variable standard format. report Logical value indicating whether print temporal coverage report.

title: Calculate the temporal Coverage — cov_temporal
text: data frame minimum maximum dates date variable.

title: Calculate the temporal Coverage — cov_temporal
text: date_format argument specified, function attempt determine format date variable automatically using tryFormats vector. date variable standard format, error thrown.

title: Calculate the temporal Coverage — cov_temporal
code: data("borreguiles") cov_temporal(borreguiles, date_var = "eventDate", report = TRUE) #> Warning: The argument date_format is not specified. A default format is assumed. See function's details #> The temporal coverage of the dataset is 1988-05-18 to 2013-10-17. #>     min_date   max_date #> 1 1988-05-18 2013-10-17

what: gbifexplorer: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries — gbifexplorer-package
title: gbifexplorer: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries — gbifexplorer-package
text: package use DarwinCore Archives computes summaries spatial, temporal taxonomical coverages. also generates friendly reports taxonomic coverage used part Data Papers.

title: gbifexplorer: Explore DarwinCore Archives and generates friendly coverage summaries — gbifexplorer-package
text: Maintainer: Antonio Jesús Pérez-Luque ajpelu@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Creates a report for a taxa rank — report_taxonomy
title: Creates a report for a taxa rank — report_taxonomy
text: Generate summary report taxonomy taxa rank

title: Creates a report for a taxa rank — report_taxonomy
Creates a report for a taxa rank — report_taxonomy
text: x data frame tibble containing frequency information taxa rank. must columns 'n' 'freq'. dataframe typically generated taxonomic_cov() top number top taxa include report. Default value 5.

title: Creates a report for a taxa rank — report_taxonomy
text: character string representing generated report.

title: Creates a report for a taxa rank — report_taxonomy
text: function generates report based input data frame 'x' containing frequency information certain taxa rank. provides information represented taxa.

title: Creates a report for a taxa rank — report_taxonomy
code: # Example usage data(borreguiles) # Calculate taxonomic coverage for scientificName and genus d <- taxonomic_cov(borreguiles, category = c("scientificName", "genus")) # Generate report report_taxonomy(d$genus) #>   There are 52 genus included in the dataset. The 5 genus most represented in the dataset are: Carex (16.58 %), Nardus (9.35 %), Scorzoneroides (9 %), Gentiana (8.8 %) and Euphrasia (6.47 %). #>

title: taxonomic_cov — taxonomic_cov
text: generates taxonomic coverage occurrence dataset. category, record numbers relative frequencies taxa computed. category argument one : scientificName, kingdom, phylum, class, order, family, subfamily genus. get coverage categories type .

title: taxonomic_cov — taxonomic_cov
code: # Example usage data(borreguiles) # Calculate taxonomic coverage for scientificName and genus taxonomic_cov(borreguiles, category = c("scientificName", "genus")) #> $scientificName #> # A tibble: 94 × 3 #>    scientificName                                             n  freq #>    <chr>                                                  <int> <dbl> #>  1 Nardus stricta L.                                       1029  9.35 #>  2 Carex nigra (L.) Reichard                                734  6.67 #>  3 Euphrasia willkommii Freyn                               712  6.47 #>  4 Lotus corniculatus L. subsp. glacialis (Boiss.) Valdés   604  5.49 #>  5 Scorzoneroides                                           585  5.32 #>  6 Eleocharis quinqueflora (Hartmann) O.Schwarz             500  4.54 #>  7 Festuca iberica (Hack.) Patzke                           491  4.46 #>  8 Carex nevadensis Boiss. & Reut.                          482  4.38 #>  9 Gentiana boryi Boiss.                                    407  3.70 #> 10 Plantago nivalis Jord.                                   321  2.92 #> # ℹ 84 more rows #>  #> $genus #> # A tibble: 52 × 3 #>    genus              n  freq #>    <chr>          <int> <dbl> #>  1 Carex           1824 16.6  #>  2 Nardus          1029  9.35 #>  3 Scorzoneroides   990  9.00 #>  4 Gentiana         968  8.80 #>  5 Euphrasia        712  6.47 #>  6 Lotus            604  5.49 #>  7 Trifolium        586  5.33 #>  8 Festuca          525  4.77 #>  9 Eleocharis       500  4.54 #> 10 Agrostis         488  4.44 #> # ℹ 42 more rows #>
